text:
<@U7SL518D6>
Hey Jon,

> This would only happen if the parent theme or child theme changed the hierarchy of the fields.
• We did not change and hierarchy of the fields. We just added a new one. 
You mean "adding new fields" on fields.json file also break the settings?
Would you like to see the new fields.json and old version via personal message?

> If you delete the fields.json in your child theme, the parent theme’s fields.json should be what’s used.
• It does not work like this, If you add a "extends" code into theme.json file with old method on your child theme, *You have to fill the fields.json file. If you do not,* you cannot access any theme settings from editor tool.
